sections.text:
## Overview
We will extend the Deployment Readiness compliance checklist to auto-populate which checklist items are *required for deployment* using customer/account context (CRM + Customer_Analyzer). When an issue/theme is linked to one or more impacted customers, the system will compute a derived required set (e.g., security review, DPA, retention constraints) based on attributes like segment/ICP, region, and regulated flags, and then highlight any missing or incomplete items. This change is additive and does not alter the existing checklist UI or user workflow; it simply pre-selects and annotates requirements to reduce manual triage and late compliance surprises.

## Inputs, rules, and derivation
Inputs come from (1) CRM account/customer attributes (e.g., legal entity, region, contract/DPA status, industry tags) and (2) Customer_Analyzer outputs (segment/ICP classification, regulated indicators, retention/data residency constraints). We will define a configurable mapping from attribute predicates → checklist requirements (e.g., `region in {EU, UK} => DPA required`, `regulated=true => security review required`, `retention_constraint != null => retention review required`). For issues/themes with multiple impacted customers, we will compute the required set as the union of all customers’ derived requirements, and store per-requirement provenance (which customer/attribute triggered it) to support explainability and debugging.

## System behavior and UI integration
On link/unlink of impacted customers, and on relevant attribute updates, we will (re)compute the derived required set and attach it to the issue/theme as derived metadata (separate from the user-edited checklist state). In the checklist UI, items that are derived-required will be auto-selected (or marked “Required”) and any unmet required items will be highlighted as gaps; items not required remain unchanged. Users can still complete checklist items as usual; we will not introduce new steps, approvals, or blocking behavior—only visibility into what is required and what is missing.

## Data model, services, and rollout
Implementation includes a small “Compliance Requirements Deriver” service/module that fetches customer context, applies the ruleset, and writes back derived requirements + provenance to the issue/theme. We’ll add telemetry for rule hits, gap counts, and manual overrides (if any), plus admin tooling/config to evolve mappings without code deploys (initially can be a versioned config file, later a managed table). Rollout will start behind a feature flag with shadow-mode validation (compute and log without UI changes), followed by enabling UI annotations for a limited set of segments/regions, then general availability once rule accuracy and performance meet targets.
